summary: This document is a certified English translation of the Israeli death certificate for David Teicher, who died on January 3, 2009, at Hadassah Ein Kerem hospital in Jerusalem. The certificate was issued by the Israeli Ministry of the Interior and notarized by Jodi Krtmerman in September 2015.

persons.name: David Teicher
persons.context: The subject of the death certificate, a married Jewish male born February 1, 1942, who died on January 3, 2009.

persons.name: Avraham Teicher
persons.context: Listed as the father of David Teicher on the death certificate.

persons.name: Rachel Teicher
persons.context: Listed as the mother of David Teicher on the death certificate.

persons.name: Jodi Krtmerman
persons.context: A notary in Tel Aviv who certified the English translation of the death certificate on September 20, 2015.

persons.name: Shchori Ester
persons.context: The clerk who signed and stamped the death certificate for the Israeli Ministry of the Interior, Chamber of Civil Register and Immigration in Tel Aviv.

events.title: Death of David Teicher
events.description: David Teicher died at Hadassah Ein Kerem hospital in Jerusalem.

events.title: Issuance of Death Certificate
events.description: The Israeli Ministry of the Interior issued the official death certificate for David Teicher.

events.title: Certification of Translation
events.description: Notary Jodi Krtmerman certified the English translation of David Teicher's Hebrew death certificate.

locations: Chamber of Civil Register and Immigration in Tel Aviv - Center
keyFacts: David Teicher, born February 1, 1942, died on January 3, 2009, in Jerusalem.
The death certificate was officially issued by the Israeli Ministry of the Interior on January 14, 2014.
An English translation of the Hebrew death certificate was notarized by Jodi Krtmerman on September 20, 2015.
The document is a formal civil record, not directly related to Jeffrey Epstein's criminal activities.
The certificate lists the deceased's parents as Avraham and Rachel Teicher.
